subject: Re: low level junit messing: "Class not found"
msgSnippet: thanks the reference to the class location (.) helped.. ... variable ... to the ... SimpleTest
messageBody:
thanks

the reference to the class location (.) helped..





--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Jan Kroeze" <thejcwk@...> wrote:
>
> Also, note that specifying -classpath will override the environment
variable
> CLASSPATH, so you need to drop that from your java command as well.
>
> 2008/5/7 Nat Pryce <nat.pryce@...>:
>
> > You need to add the directory containing your compiled classes
to the
> > classpath.
> >
> > --Nat
> >
> > 2008/5/7 ben.aurel <ben.aurel@... <ben.aurel%40yahoo.com>>:
> >
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > > Hi
> > > I just try to do some first steps with junit. Despite of all the
> > > tutorials, blogposts, etc. it seems impossible to me.
> > >
> > > Here's what I want to do:
> > > 1. writing a simple test
> > > 2. compiling the test
> > > 3. running the test in the commandline
> > >
> > > Here's what I did:
> > > system:
> > > - junit.jar lives in /opt/java/libraries
> > >
> > > Env. vars:
> > > - .bash_profile:
> > > -- $CLASSPATH:/opt/java/libraries/junit.jar
> > > -- $JLIBS:/opt/java/libraries
> > >
> > > $ cat SimpleTest.java
> > > import junit.framework.TestCase;
> > > public class SimpleTest extends TestCase {
> > > public void testTry() {
> > > fail("Not yet implemented.");
> > > }
> > > }
> > >
> > > $ javac -classpath $JLIBS/junit.jar SimpleTest.java
> > >
> > > $ java -classpath $JLIBS/junit.jar junit.textui.TestRunner
SimpleTest
> > >
> > > the same with:
> > >
> > > $ java -classpath $JLIBS/junit.jar junit.textui.TestRunner
> > > SimpleTest.testTry
> > > Class not found "SimpleTest.testTry"
> > >
> > > Class not found "SimpleTest"
> > >
> > > I just can't solved that error. I think I'm going crazy.
> > >
> > > Can somebody help me?
> > >
> > > Thanks
> > > Ben
> > >
> > >
> >
> >
>
>
>
> --
> Jan Kroeze
>
>
